ul.li1: 191 Better a poor person walking in integrity
ul.li2: than one who is perverse in his speechLiterally “in his lips” and is a fool.
ul.li1: 2Also, a lifeOr “soul,” or “inner self” without knowledge is not good,
ul.li2: and he who moves quickly with his feet misses the mark.Or “sins”
ul.li1: 3As for the folly of humankind, its way leads to ruin,
ul.li2: and against Yahweh his heartOr “mind” will rage.
ul.li1: 4Wealth adds many friends,
ul.li2: but the poor will be left by his friends.
ul.li1: 5A witness of falsehood will not go unpunished,
ul.li2: and he who breathes lies will not escape.
ul.li1: 6Many will seek favor before the generous,
ul.li2: and everyone is the friend of a man of gifts.Hebrew “gift”
ul.li1: 7All the brothers of the poor, if they hate him,
ul.li2: how much more will his friends keep away from him.
He pursues them with words, and they are gone.Or “when he pursues words and not them”
ul.li1: 8He who acquires wisdom loves himself;Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: he who guards understanding loves to find good.
ul.li1: 9A false witness will not go unpunished,
ul.li2: and he who breathes lies will perish.
ul.li1: 10For a fool living in luxury is not fitting,
ul.li2: any more than it is for a slave to rule over princes.
ul.li1: 11The understanding of a person makes him slow to his anger,Literally “nostril”
ul.li2: and his glory overlooks offense.
ul.li1: 12The rage of a king growls like a lion,
ul.li2: but his favor is like dew on the grass.
ul.li1: 13A foolish child is a ruin to his father,
ul.li2: and the quarreling of a womanOr “wife” is a continuous dripping.
ul.li1: 14A house and wealth are an inheritance from fathers,
ul.li2: but from Yahweh comes a womanOr “wife” who is prudent.
ul.li1: 15Laziness will bring on a deep sleep,
ul.li2: and a personOr “soul,” or “life” of idleness will suffer hunger.
ul.li1: 16He who guards commandments guards his life;Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: he who is careless of his ways will be killed.
ul.li1: 17He who lends to Yahweh is he who is kind to the poor,
ul.li2: and his benefits he will repay to him.
ul.li1: 18Discipline your child, for there is hope,
ul.li2: but on his destruction do not set your desire.Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 19A hot-tempered person pays a penalty;
ul.li2: if you rescue him, you will do it yet again.
ul.li1: 20Listen to advice and accept instruction
ul.li2: so that you will gain wisdom for your future.Literally “after things”
ul.li1: 21Many plans are in the heartOr “mind” of a man,
ul.li2: but the purpose of Yahweh will be established.
ul.li1: 22The craving of a man is his steadfast loyalty,
ul.li2: and it is better to be poor than a liar.Literally “man of lying”
ul.li1: 23Fear of Yahweh leads to life;
ul.li2: he who is filled with it will rest—he will not suffer harm.
ul.li1: 24A lazy person buries his hand in the dish,
ul.li2: and even to his mouth he will not bring it back.
ul.li1: 25The scoffer you shall strike, and the simple, may they learn prudence,
ul.li2: and reprove the intelligent and he will gain knowledge.
ul.li1: 26He who does violence to a father, he who chases away a mother,
ul.li2: is a child who causes shame and brings reproach.
ul.li1: 27Cease to listen to instruction, my child,
ul.li2: and you will strayLiterally “in order to stray” from sayings of knowledge.
ul.li1: 28A worthless witness will mock justice,
ul.li2: and the mouth of the wicked will devour iniquity.
ul.li1: 29JudgmentsOr “Punishments,” or “Condemnations” are prepared for the scoffers,
ul.li2: and flogging for the back of fools.
